page.title: 01THE MEYSEY HAMPTON AREA
page.content: Our block lies to the west of the village of Meysey Hampton in the eastern Cotswolds, about half way between Cirencester and Fairford. Most of the land is farming land, mainly arable and grassland. There are two villages lying mostly in our block: Meysey Hampton and Poulton. The houses are built of Cotswold stone and there are many Cotswold stone walls round the fields. There is an iron age site at Ranbury Rings but it is not open to the public because there are no footpaths to it. The nearest big town is Swindon which is 16 miles away. Many people in our area travel to work there and some even travel by train from Swindon to work in London.
